meanings.definition: Having a high degree of heat or a high temperature.
meanings.sent1: The sun is hotter than the moon.
meanings.sent2: Summer days are usually hotter than winter days.
meanings.sent3: The chili was so hot, it made my mouth burn!
meanings.sent4: The competition is heating up, getting hotter by the minute.
meanings.sent5: The fire grew hotter and hotter, blazing brightly.

meanings.definition: More hot in temperature than something else.
meanings.sent1: My tea is hotter than yours.
meanings.sent2: The desert is always hotter than the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The race to the finish line is getting hotter!
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was getting hotter, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The argument between them was getting hotter and hotter, escalating quickly.

meanings.definition: Having a strong or spicy flavor.
meanings.sent1: This curry is hotter than the one we had last time.
meanings.sent2: Mexican food tends to be hotter than Italian food.
meanings.sent3: The salsa was so hot, it made my eyes water!
meanings.sent4: The debate was getting hotter, with each side defending their spicy opinions.
meanings.sent5: The argument over the best hot sauce was getting hotter, with everyone passionately arguing their favorite.
